New Records: Mitchell Santner became the first New Zealand spinner to register a five-wicket haul in Men's Cricket World Cup history.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Santner showed all-round brilliance for New Zealand, and followed up his quickfire 36* with the first five-for (5/59) of the ongoing tournament.
Will Young was the team's top-scorer with 70.
Rachin Ravindra scored a half-century for New Zealand against Netherlands at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
A crucial 53-run stand between Mitchell and Latham helped New Zealand cross 200.
Netherlands fell 99 runs short of the New Zealand's lofty total of 322/7 in Hyderabad.
Colin Ackermann was Netherlands' highest-scorer with 69.
Trent Boult took a superb catch on the boundary against Netherlands in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards won the toss for the second time in a row and elected yet again to take the field.
New Zealand were boosted by the return of Lockie Ferguson in place of James Neesham.
Kane Williamson and Tim Southee weren't available for selection today.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Netherlands made two changes into their XI. Klein and Sybrand Engelbrecht made it into the playing XI.
Logan van Beek was out due to a hamstring strain.
New Zealand adopted an aggressive approach throughout their innings to belt out a big total in Hyderabad.
